name: Baptism
rites: The Absolution of the Woman, The prayers of renouncing the devil and affirming the Christian faith, The Liturgy of the Water and The Baptism and Bathing Prayer
description: The sacrament of Baptism is the first Sacrament that is received and through it a person becomes a new member of the Church. We see Christ says this in John 3:5, "Most Assuredly I say to you. Unless one is born o water and the Spirit, he cannot enter the kingdom of God" Baptism is split into 4 main rites, 1. The Absolution of the Woman 2. The prayers of renouncing the devil 3. The Liturgy of the Water and finally 4. The Baptism and the Bathing Prayer. This concludes the Sacrament of Baptism

name: Chrismation
rites: 36 Anointments: all the joints and senses of the human body
description: Through the sacrament of Chrismation, sometimes refereed to as the sacrament of the holy anointment, we are blessed and recieve the confirmation of the gift of the Holy Spirit. Thus, our body becomes a temple for the Holy Spirit that is consecrated for God. In the Orthodox Church this sacrament is performed right after Baptisim. After the baptisim the priest annoints the child or adult 36 times, corresponding to all the major organs of the body to bless them and consecrate them for God. These 36 anointments also include all joints and senses of the body so that they may be protected from all evil. Finally, the sacrament end with the priest blessing the recipeient with the sign of the cross and says "Accept the Holy Spirit and be a vessel pure through Jesus Christ our God, to Him is due Glory with His good Father and the Holy Spirit ". This concludes the Sacrament of Chrismation.

name: Eucharist
rites: Holy spirit desceding upon the offering and upon the congreation
description: The sacrament of the Eucharist is most commonly refered to as Holy Communion, in which the faithful partake of the Holy Body and Blood of Christ. This sacrament is deemed one of the most important and called the "The Sacrament of Sacraments or the Crown fo Sacraments" The most recognizable biblical reference and the institution of this Sacrament was the Last Supper, when Jesus Christ broke bread with his disciples. This is reffered to in the book of John 6:50 when Jesus says " This is the bread which came down from heaven, that one may eat of it and not die" and in John 6:54 when He says "Whoever eats My flesh and drinks My blood has eternal life, and I will raise him up at the last day" This sacrament takes place during the Divine Liturgy, during which the Holy Spirit descends upon the Offering of bread and wine to transform it to the Body and Blood of Christ our God. The Holy Spirtit also decends upon the congregation to purify them and make them worthy to partake of the Communion, and through the partaking of communion the Sacrament of the Eucharist is concluded.

name: Repentance
rites: Prayer before Confession, and Prayer after Confession
description: The sacarament of Repetance, also refered to as Confession, is the sacrament through which a sinner repents before God. This is done through the oral confession of sins to a priest, in order to recieve the aboslution and forgivness of sins. Often times the confessor also recieves guidance from their father of confession and spirtiual training to help overcome sins. The act of confession, and the forgivness of sins is mentioned several times throughout the Bible. In 1 John 1:9 St. John says " If we confess our sins, He is faithful and just to forgive us our sins and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness" and Proverbs 28:13 says " He who covers his sins will not prosper, but whoever confesses and forsakes them will have mercey" Unlike the other sacraments, the sacrament of Repentance does not have a designated time, and is performed at the discretion of the confessor. Confession is not only stating the sins that were comitted, but also a repentance and regret for the sins that were commited before God. The confesor should have feelings of regret and contempt because of their sins, but be filled with hope and joy for being able to recieve forgivness through this sacrament. One of the most important asspects of this sacrament is consistincy and confessing whenever you have fallen into temptation St John Chrysostom says, " If you sin.. enter the church and erase your sins. Just like how you would get up immedietly after falling in the street, do the same when you sin. Do not give up on yourself. If you sin a second time, repent a second time and never lose hope, for the church is a hospital and not a court. Finally, after recievenig the absolution and forgiveness the Sacrament of Repentence is concluded.

name: Unction of the Sick
description: The sacarament of Repetance, also refered to as Confession, is the sacrament through which a sinner repents before God. This is done through the oral confession of sins to a priest, in order to recieve the aboslution and forgivness of sins. Finally, after recievenig the absolution and forgiveness the Sacrament of Repentence is concluded.

name: Matrimony
rites: Engagement, Earnest of Marriage, The Holy Crowning
description: The sacrament of Matrimony is embodied by a verse in Matthew 19:6 " So then, they are no longer two but one flesh. Therefore what God has joined together, let not man seperate" This is the sacrament of marriage, when the Holy Spirit descends upton the bride and groom and makes them one and purifies them. Christ himself blessed this sacrament when He attended the wedding at Cana of Galilee. The sacrament is divided into 3 parts, Engagement, Earnest of Marriage, and The Holy Crowning. Each part has its own rites, however the earnest of marriage and crowning are almost always performed during one ceremony. After the 3 parts have been completed, the Scarament of Matrimony is concluded.

name: Priesthood
rites: Deacon Ordination, Priest Ordination and Bishop Ordination
description: The Sacrament of Priesthood is the ordination of clergy members, performed by a Bishop or the Pope. In this holy mystery the bishop or Pope lays hands on the head of an elected candidate, and prays on his behalf so that the Holy Spirit may descend upon him, and grant him one of the ranks of priesthood. This sacrament started when the Lord Jesus Christ came on earth and chode his 12 disciples and sanctified them for service. There are 3 types of ordinations that can take place, the Deacon ordination, the Priest ordination and the Bishop ordination.
